column4: gumby you will have to edit your upstart scripts in /etc/event.d
sorry, I should be more specific.  via command line

yes, I know how to start/stop services.  Just need to disable.  You used to be able to use chkconfig etc to enable/disable items for different runlevels.  It seems like a step backwards to go back to needing to edit txt files in order to change what starts on each runlevel
it also does not appear that 10.10 has /etc/event.d either
